adjective.description: Not conforming or corresponding; disagreeing; inconsistent. Chiefly with to.

verb.description: To fail to conform; to disagree, differ. Frequently with to, with, †from.

origin: Mid 16th century; earliest use found in Bannatyne Miscellany. From dis- + conform, perhaps after post-classical Latin disconformis<br>mid 17th century; earliest use found in John Hacket (1592–1670), bishop of Coventry and Lichfield. From dis- + conform.
